DataElement.preferredName: FISI 3 Past Month How Often Experience Accidental Bowel Leakage of Liquid Stool Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated response of how often in the past month they experienced any amount of accidental bowel leakage as liquid stool, using a 6 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fecal Incontinence Severity Index Past 30 days How Often Experience Accidental Bowel Leakage of Liquid Stool Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized questionnaire developed by Todd et al. in 1999 that utilizes a six-point scale to create a severity rating score based on four types of fecal incontinence, including gas, mucus, liquid stool, and solid stool.:A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._A question about how often an individual experiences any amount of accidental bowel leakage of liquid stool._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CCTG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: For each of the following, please indicate on average how often in the past month you experienced any amount of accidental bowel leakage: Liquid Stool

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: FISI: Fecal Incontinence Severity Index, T. Rockwood et al., 1999, Dis Colon Rectum
